application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: Sycamore (T15) - Reduce back to previous points of reduction. 1.5m reduction in height and 0.5m reduction in width, leaving a canopy spread of 3m and height of 4.5m because it has reached its four year cycle and it creates excess shading for the flats.Maple (T40) - Reduce back to previous points of reduction. 1.5m reduction in height and 0.5m reduction in width, leaving a canopy spread of 3m and height of 4.5m because it has reached its four year cycle and it creates excess shading for the flats.Lime (T41) - Reduce back to previous points of reduction. 1.5m reduction in height and 0.5m reduction in width, leaving a canopy spread of 3m and height of 4.5m because it has reached its four year cycle and it creates excess shading for the flats.Oak (T43) - Removal of deadwood.
